poem:
Title: The Muddled Figures

A stern claim
stood on the morning paper,
silent,
amid the sacrilege of dollars.

Stewards in unstudied err,
the austere façades
of KPMG,
casting shadows of doubt.

Controversy, aflame,
burning like the crisp paper-
an inferno of dispute,
The wind sings a requiem.

Ah, the bewilderment:
Which company?
Were they wrong?
Answers pale in the rising sun,
as the tap-dancing figures melt
into the day's humdrum.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Incredible failure’: KPMG rejects claims it assessed ‘the wrong company’ before $423m payment to Paladin Consultancy firm KPMG Australia has rejected claims it conducted due diligence on “the wrong company” before the federal government gave nearly half a billion dollars to a controversial company with no track record. The firm’s objection to comments by a member of a Senate inquiry examining its conduct come after weeks of intense criticism and accusations it repeatedly misled parliament". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Incredible failure’: KPMG rejects claims it assessed ‘the wrong company’ before $423m payment to Paladin Consultancy firm KPMG Australia has rejected claims it conducted due diligence on “the wrong company” before the federal government gave nearly half a billion dollars to a controversial company with no track record. The firm’s objection to comments by a member of a Senate inquiry examining its conduct come after weeks of intense criticism and accusations it repeatedly misled parliament
